title: Fix createActor agentOptions warning and show Navbar menu icon on desktop

requirements.text: Remove the production console warning `Detected both agent and agentOptions passed to createActor. Ignoring agentOptions and proceeding with the provided agent.` by ensuring the frontend actor creation path passes only one of `agent` or `agentOptions` to the underlying `createActor` implementation (including the authenticated identity case in `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`).

quotes: index-jhAZLbjQ.js:24578 Detected both agent and agentOptions passed to createActor. Ignoring agentOptions and proceeding with the provided agent.

acceptanceCriteria: When loading the live production build, the browser console no longer logs `Detected both agent and agentOptions passed to createActor...` during normal app startup/authenticated usage.
Authenticated users still create an actor that uses the logged-in Internet Identity `identity` (no regression in login-required flows).

requirements.text: Update the global Navbar header UI so a menu icon is visible on desktop/web and is positioned at the top-right of the page, and clicking it opens the same right-side navigation sheet currently used on mobile.

quotes: show menu icon in web version
put menu icon on the righthand top of the page that opens at browser

acceptanceCriteria: On desktop viewport widths, the header shows a menu (hamburger) icon on the top-right.
Clicking the menu icon opens the right-side navigation sheet and navigation items work as before.
On mobile viewport widths, the menu icon still works and the navigation sheet still opens correctly (no regression).

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts or other paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.frontend.immutablePaths.
Use English for any user-facing text introduced or modified by these changes.
nonGoals: Do not add new authentication providers beyond Internet Identity.
Do not implement real-time messaging (no WebSockets).
